alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Morris; Titus (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 08 at 3:46PM CST until February 12 at 7:31PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Shreveport LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... White Oak Creek Near Talco affecting Morris, Franklin and Titus Counties. For the White Oak Creek...including Talco...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White Oak Creek Near Talco. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding. Move livestock and equipment to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 15.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.0 feet on 03/31/1990. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 345 PM CST.
